page.title: 19Public Services
page.content: GLASCOED TREATMENT WORKS continued New Works: Recently a new 16" main costing Â£64,000 has been laid to bring additional water from Plas Uchaf Reservoir to Glascoed and work is nearing completion on a constriction of a 4 million glallon reinforced concrete service reservoir costing Â£256,700 to increase the output of the treatment plant. This will provide an adequate reserve of treated water. The Plant is to be installed to enable sludge to be separated from the water which is used to wash out the filters at an estimated cost of Â£63,000 when capital is available.
